docs.snippet: The Maritime Commission announced yesterday afternoon the names, new owners and registry of 204 more war-built merchant ships on which title passed either to American private owners or foreign nations, under terms of the Merchant Ship Sales Act of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Maritime Commission announced yesterday afternoon the names, new owners and registry of 204 more war-built merchant ships on which title passed either to American private owners or foreign nations, under terms of the Merchant Ship Sales Act of 1946, in the final two months of last year.
docs.abstract: lists names, new owners and registry of 204 ships sold under Ship Sales Act during Nov and Dec; Liberty type lead noted

headline.main: COMMISSION LISTS 204 VESSELS SOLD; Liberty Type Leads Merchant Ships Taken by American and Foreign Buyers

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N. Y., Jan. 28 --The United Nations Human Rights Commission spent today arguing what to do with the 1,000odd human rights petitions sent to the United Nations from aggrieved private citizens, agencies and oppressed minority groups.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N. Y., Jan. 28 --The United Nations Human Rights Commission spent today arguing what to do with the 1,000odd human rights petitions sent to the United Nations from aggrieved private citizens, agencies and oppressed minority groups.
docs.abstract: session; names subcom on press freedom

headline.main: U. N. STUDIES PLEAS FOR HUMAN RIGHTS; Commission Members Will Be Allowed to Inspect Petitions --Romulo Fears 'Reprisals'

docs.snippet: The Moore-McCormack Lines have taken formal delivery of the new cargo-passenger vessel Mor acsaga, last of seven modified C-3 type ships to be built for the company by the Ingalls Shipbuilding Corporation at Pascagoula, Miss., Albert V. Moore,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Moore-McCormack Lines have taken formal delivery of the new cargo-passenger vessel Mor acsaga, last of seven modified C-3 type ships to be built for the company by the Ingalls Shipbuilding Corporation at Pascagoula, Miss., Albert V. Moore, president of the company, announced yesterday.

headline.main: C-3 SHIP ACCEPTED FOR ATLANTIC RUN; Moore-McCormack Completes $21,000,000 Building Program With the Mormacsaga
